summary: A U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List detailing the extensive international travel history of Ghislaine Maxwell from 2000 to 2019, generated in September 2019. The document shows her frequent flights between the U.S., Europe, the Caribbean, and the Middle East, primarily using a passport.

persons.name: Ghislaine Noelle Marion Maxwell
persons.context: The sole individual listed in this travel encounter log, showing her extensive international movements via commercial and private flights over nearly two decades.

events.title: Early recorded flight
events.description: First entry in the log showing Ghislaine Maxwell traveling on a private flight (tail number 505LS).

events.title: Most recent recorded flight before document generation
events.description: Last entry in the log showing Ghislaine Maxwell using Automated Passport Control at Boston Logan Airport (BOS) on a flight from London Heathrow (LHR).

keyFacts: The document is a comprehensive travel log for Ghislaine Maxwell spanning from January 2000 to June 2019, showing hundreds of international flights.

Maxwell traveled extensively between the United States (primarily Boston, New York, Miami, Palm Beach) and international destinations including London, Paris, Tokyo, Doha, Caribbean islands, and the Middle East.
She used both commercial flights (with APIS - Advanced Passenger Information System records) and private flights (with tail numbers like N17ND, N923CL, 909JE).
The log shows frequent use of Automated Passport Control (APC) systems at U.S. airports, particularly in Boston and New York.

The document was generated on September 23, 2019, by U.S. Customs and Border Protection, indicating law enforcement interest in her travel patterns around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and death.
